reviews.text: Perfect location in city centre; walking distance to Main train station, 10 min walk to the walkway along the river Main, 15 min walk to Romer and Dom Cathedral, 20 min walk to Zeil (shopping pedestrian only street) and 5 min walk to financial district (make sure to take the elevator up to the top of the Main Tower, 200 meter platform, fantastic view over the whole city). Couldn't have been more pleased with the Hotel Victoria, my late check-in only took about one minute and staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms are small but efficient, very clean, all renovated in modern decor. Breakfast buffet very nice and great start to a busy day. What I was most pleased with is the breakfast that was made for me when I checked out; I had to be at the airport at 5am and front desk ordered a taxi for me for 4:30am. I did not expect a breakfast that early in the morning at the hotel (usually served from 7-11am). When I came downstairs to check out, the front staff told us that he's preparing a breakfast for the two of us to take along. He had put fruit, juice and cereal bar in a lunch bag and gave us bread with a selection of jams, honey, cheese and cold cuts to make a sandwich and wrap it up. He also prepared a coffee for me. I was already very happy with the hotel but this definitely topped all my expectations.
reviews.title: Great location, super service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for one night after flying into Frankfurt and before we caught a train elsewhere. 2 blocks from train station and fairly close (walking distance) to the historical center. Our room was nice - actually pretty cool, and it had a small separate sitting area with a chaise lounge. But the bathroom was tiny, and there was a lot of street noise. However, the street noise was mainly during the day. Besides the occasional siren, the street noise wasn't a bother when I was sleeping.
reviews.title: Good for 1 night stopover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Victoria Hotel for one night as stopover from overseas flight and as a jumping off point for other European travel. We were drawn to good value right near the train station where we had to pick up a rental car the next day. But like any other big city, train stations draw some seedy characters and to top it off Victoria Hotel is right on the edge of the Frankfurt red light district. But in June it gets dark late so never really felt unsafe. Hotel is clean, rooms are small. Breakfast was good with cereals, sliced meats, scrambled eggs and sausage. I would recommend the place for short, summer time visit
reviews.title: NIce Basic Place for a stopover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we were lucky enough to get upgraded to a junior suite, and having come from a 13 sq meter room in paris the night before, this was 3-4 times bigger. good experience, free internet in reception, would go back to this hotel.
reviews.title: recommended

reviews.text: Stayed at the Victoria in May with our small baby and the room was excellent, the staff were great and the location was good for the Hauptbanhof (main station).
reviews.title: Could be a 4 star..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel for its close proximity to the main train station as we were only spending one evening in Frankfurt and then taking a train to another city. We found the hotel to be clean, recently renovated and in a good location. It is true that families might want to avoid some of the surrounding streets in the evenings but there are still lots of ways to get around them and we never felt unsafe as there were always people around. If you are here for the christmas markets it is definitely within easy walking distance to one of them. There were plenty of restaurants in the area as well. The hotel served a good breakfast in the morning that was complimentary so that is always a nice bonus. Our room was quiet and we had no complaints for hallway noise. Overall this was a great hotel and we would certainly recommend it if you need to be close to a train station.
reviews.title: Great starting/ending point

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The people at this hotel are nice and helpful but unfortunately their hotel lets them down. My husband and I booked a junior suite! and got a bedroom (2 singles pushed together which kept sliding apart) with a couch facility! Not what we would class as a suite at all, and not very large. The bathroom was also small. However it was extremely clean and cleaned well each day :o)
reviews.title: Average only

reviews.text: The location is described as central, but it is very close to the Adult entertainment area and there are some unsavioury characters hanging about after 7/8pm. There are tea/coffee facilities but not very convienent (one of those machines you need to use specific cartridges in and mainly coffee provided - I am a tea drinker :-\ so had to resort to buying small kettle) Although the breakfast is a buffet and there are loads of it there was not much choice/variety.
reviews.title: Overpriced and no parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However there are some very good, reasonable restaurants around this hotel which I would happily recommend. I cannot fault the staff at this hotel as they did their best and were most polite and helpful as best they could.
reviews.title: Close to everything

reviews.text: This hotel was overpriced. The room was very small, the shower was tiny, the neighborhood is sketchy, there is not a parking area for the hotel, no free wifi, the "queen" bed consisted of two twin beds pushed together, but the room was clean and updated.
reviews.title: clean hotel but short beds and no free wifi in bad area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As usual, our experience upon arriving at night was not very cool. Firstly, because it was the first time any hotel had demanded full payment of our stay (6 nights) up front! Okay, so we paid up as were prepared - with all Cash, to the surprise of the woman at the reception. Then, as usual, we being Canadian Indian citizens, were given a matchbox size room for the night, where there was no place to move once you set down your luggage! Anyway, the next morning while returning from breakfast, my wife noticed that a proper good room near the elevator was obviuosly being cleaned as the guests had left. We immediately asked to change the room, to which the new receptionist could not instantly give any excuse for and eventually agreed because she checked we had fully paid up last night. If it were not for that, our stay in this hotel would really have been miserable. I still don't get why hotels jealously guard their best rooms for white guests even though they are ling vacant and can be easly voluntarily given to slightly colored guests like us! And how they can charge the same rate for a proper room and a totally different miniature room!
reviews.title: Most convenient location in Frankfurt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were small and very hot on a summer night. Hotel advertised air conditioning, but I do not think it worked. The bathroom reminded me of a cruise ship. The decor was very nice. Breakfast was average at best. Hotel also advertised free use of a computer in the lobby, but it was broken! The staff was very helpful and even called a restaurant to make reservations for us. Good location if you need to be near the train station since it is within walking distance. Ask for a larger room and hope that it is a night when you do not need to open the windows since it will be loud.
reviews.title: average hotel near train station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there for two nights from dec. 11th to dec. 13 going towards our trip to US. The hotel is very good located if you want to catch a train to go to the airport, but also is at a short distance from the end of the commercial street of Frankfurt, the Zeil. Moreover, the river isn't far and on the way to the center you will bump into European Central Bank building. The rooms have been recently renovated, and now furniture and paintings are giving a taste of modern to the environment. We had also breakfasts, I remember me and my wife were happy. Bathroom, bed, windows in our room were in perfect order, also TV lcd. I also booked through booking. com and I payed at the arrival or at the end of the staying, don't remember.
reviews.title: Very good hotel, good position and stylish rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would advice you to stay in Victoria Hotel, to visit Frankfurt, to stay waiting for a connection, to shop in the city.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.text: We had 2 nights at this hotel on our European trip, we arrived around 7.30am, the receptionist was very apologetic that she did not have a room ready, but no one had left yet!!, she suggested we have breakfast and hopefully by then someone may have checked out, in the few mins a couple came down, checked out of their double room, whilst we had breakfast the receptionist had arranged for the room to be cleaned and it was available to us by the time we had finished breakfast. The room was lovely, a corner room very stylish, great bed. The hotel was 5 mins walk from the train station and easy walking distance to the city centre, we got this room for under $100 AUD with breakfast. Would defiantly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Good value for the money

reviews.text: The location of the hotel was convenient as it is situated near a train station and not far from the city centre. Furtemore,my room was very clean. The staff is helpful and polite.
reviews.title: Good hotel in Frankfurt

reviews.text: I didn't like the surrounding neighborhood. It is not the best for family travellers (there are some sex shops and drunk people alround at midnight). Also i found my room small.
reviews.title: Great value, very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Victoria Hotel during this past Frankfurt bookfair. It was our first stay at this hotel, and I was aware it was located near some "red light" streets so I was a bit anxious.
reviews.title: Very pleased!

reviews.text: When we arrived there we saw that Elbestrasse was indeed "colourful" but as soon as we got in the hotel and started about with our business, we forgot about it. The room was on the 5th and top floor, very spacious and clean, with what looked like brand new furniture. Price was 280 EUR with breakfast, and it was a double (more like a triple, for European standards). Bathroom was small but very cleverly organized and well kept. An interesting feature was sound-proof doors in between each two rooms, so it kept noise level from the corridor to zero. We left windows open a bit courageously on the first day -it was very hot and we had to, although we thought all the "street life" would crawl up to our room- but we slept like babies. Later, we realized that what we had mistaken for heating only was also a fine AC! Wi-fi connection easy to use and very conveniently priced at 35 EUR for five whole days. Breakfast was good, and very nice staff as well, from the reception desk to the cleaning ladies. A very nice, polite supervisor came in the first day, a few minutes after we were let in the room, to ask if everything was ok. And it truly was.
reviews.title: nice hotel, good location, small rooms

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel for great value, and I believe if it was but a couple of streets off, they could ask for a lot more. Other pros: a lot of reasonably priced restaurants along the way to the Messe, so if you are coming back and starving you don't even have to stop by the hotel, you can sit down and feed! Cons: again, it will not do as a meeting place for business or colleagues, you'll have to take all appointments elsewhere, but apart from that, it was a very pleasant and satisfactory stay.
reviews.title: One of the best close to central station

reviews.text: I went to Frankfurt for a two days after Christmas, ans was looking for an easy low-cost hotel, as my plan was to spend most of the time visiting the city. The price and location of Victoria Hotel seemed fine to me, 2 blocks of the Central Station and close to the downtown. In addition, they had triple room, what would be useful in my case. Actually, it is a little bit old building, and the decoration shows it. But is very clean and nothing was broken or dirty, what is the most important. The rooms are large, even the double, and comfortable. The employees are nice helpful and speak very good english. The breakfast was well served, with good options according to a standard German one. I think it is a good option for short visit to Frankfurt, as tourist or businessman.
reviews.title: Very good surprise

reviews.text: The Victoria Hotel is not fancy--don't expect a resort hotel--but it's an excellent choice if you need sensible, clean accomodations in a convenient location.
reviews.title: A lovely stay

reviews.text: The hotel appears to be newly refurbished--the first floor had active construction going on. The construction will not impact your stay--we only noticed it because the elevator stopped on that floor.
reviews.title: Clean and a great bargain and location

reviews.text: The rooms are small--single rooms are downright tiny--but efficienty arranged and immaculately clean. Although the room was non-smoking, we got a faint smoke aroma, which seemed to get worse at night--I think someone was smoking in a nearby room. Although our room fronted the street we heard no street noise through the well-insulated windows. Our double room had two narrow beds (as is typical in Germany) and fluffy duvets. The heating system worked well. The bathroom has a tub/shower arrangement with an exceptionally deep tub raised slightly above floor level. If you have mobiity issues this could be a problem; if you love deep bathtubs, you'll be in heaven.
reviews.title: Clean hotel with friendly staff.

reviews.text: The staff spoke English and were polite and friendly without being overly friendly and were very helpful.
reviews.title: Small hotel, very helpful staff, good experience

reviews.text: The hotel was simple. The Internet connection was free, as long as you sat in the lobby. That was fine by me.
reviews.title: A Diamond in the Rough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The price was 70 Euros, which included a decent breakfast buffet.
reviews.title: Clean, quiet and comfortable

reviews.text: I needed a convenient overnight stay one night prior to my flight out after the Volcano Crisis. This Hotel is 5 minutes walk from the main train station, (and the airport only 10 minutes by train) The reviews here enticed me even though warnings about 'red light' area. These are mainly on the sidestreets and can be avoided unless you want them. The street by day is busy and certainly very safe, the evenings late at night for a single female traveller might concern. But overall there are enough people around unless you would be wandering in the early morning hours, (not recommended anywhere really) The main shopping Galleria is 10 minutes walk in the Centre of town and scenic, with restaurants, and fine shops.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel itself is entirely renovated, rooms with hardwood floors, interesting art throughout and you have the impression you are staying at a fine little European Boutique hotel.... clean well appointed room with enough space for two ( even though being single I wanted more space so I booked the Double room for a single person for a few dollars more, worth it.) Flat screen TV, desk, armoire, room safe, telephone, compact but perfectly setup Water Closet with shower sink and toilet, very clean and new. (no bathtub).
reviews.title: handy location

reviews.text: Hotel was good value for money clean and tidy with good decor. Location ok, possible to walk to Romer area better if its not freezing cold when you do. Train station can be seen from the hotel easily accessible. Staff were polite and helpful however it would have been nice to see a smile and welcoming attitude. Doesn't affect rating but compared with other places it's nice to feel welcome in the place you are staying.
reviews.title: Lovely rooms, a smile would be nice :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only stayed in this hotel for one night so it was perfect to have it so close to the main Frankfurt Train station...hotel is clean and rooms are very small but nice. I was worried about the area based on other reviews, but found it to be fine...we walked to the main shopping area from the hotel and enjoyed the GREAT farmer's market that was going on - definitely convenient if you are only there for a short time. Breakfast was very good.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location, close to train station, close to shops. Very nice staff, good food, center of town, very clean, we loved it
reviews.title: Very comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I love to travel to Europe. When we do, we stay at hotels that are convenient, clean, and reasonable. This one is "All of the above." If you are a Disney World/Hot tub type, maybe this isn't for you.......We would recommend eating at Adolph Wagner's....using Earl Steinbicker's guide book (Daytripsbooks.com) for a truly authentic cultural experience!
reviews.title: We Are Going Back This Week!

reviews.text: My stay at the Victoria Hotel in Frankfurt was a pleasant one, The hotel is very basic, clean, central and the staff was friendly and very helpful.
reviews.title: Good place to stay.

reviews.text: Breakfast was also very good. We were 2 people on this trip and booked a triple room which was the same price as a twin room at the time. The room was spacious and the bathroom very clean. The only drawback was the busy street outside the hotel. Nothing earplugs can't fix. Overall a very pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Small Rooms but Helpful Staff
reviews.text: The Victoria Hotel am Main is a great hotel. I love the hotel’s close location to the Main train station. This makes the transition from the airport to the city very simple. The breakfast was wonderful! The staff was very helpful. The rooms were small but very clean and comfortable. There is computer/internet access in the lobby. The only draw back to this hotel was the adult stores in this area of town.

likes.liked: — Quiet Room, Comfortable Beds, Hot Shower, Helpful Staff, Nice Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Staff is great help.

likes.disliked: — The size of the first room we had.

reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel - the room was suprisingly small. We had to climb over the bed and our 2 suitcases to get to the bathroom (also tiny but functional - hair dryer & hot shower) and the door. The beds are comfortable but very low to the floor and our room smelled of stale cigarette smoke even though it was supposed to be a non-smoking room. The staff was very helpful and nice - they were very happy to offer suggestions on restaurants, shopping and getting around town. They had a nice complimentary breakfast buffet that may have seemed like an odd combination of foods - seafood salad, salami, smoked salmon, soft boiled eggs and lots of breads... also cereal, yogurt and fruit.
reviews.title: you get what you paid for
